images.title: David Martin / Scolton Manor - The Railway Area
images.caption: The Railway Area. This is a static display comprising the original Sarnau Signal Box and restored 0-6-0 locomotive 'Margaret'.

images.title: Entrance to Scolton Museum and Visitor Centre by Martyn Harries, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Entrance to Scolton Museum and Visitor Centre

images.title: Garth Newton / Scolton Manor
images.caption: Pembrokeshire's County Museum is a Victorian manor house set in 60 acres of park and woodland.

description: Explore 60 acres of country park surrounding this Victorian manor house in Haverfordwest. There are woodland trails and grassland in the park while in and around the manor you can enjoy grand period rooms, railway displays, a farming exhibition, a costume exhibition, stable, art exhibitions and a World War II homefront exhibition. Scolton Manor is located about 5 miles north of Haverfordwest.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The excellent Llys y Fran Reservoir Country Park is located just a few miles to the north east of the park. There's a lovely circular cycling and walking trail here with a visitor centre and lots of wildlife to see to. You could also try our Haverfordwest Walk which takes you along the Cleddau River to Little Milford.

display_address: B4329, North Court Farm, Spittal, Ambleston, Pembrokeshire, Cymru / Wales, SA62 5QL, United Kingdom
